conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee—I'm Student_D and I’m formally applying. School_E is my first choice because I strongly value its academic environment and I’m ready to commit fully if admitted. I would be honored to join and contribute to the community.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. Although School_E ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_A), an early strong application is still my best shot at landing my #1 before the seat is taken. If rejected, I can pivot next round to School_A where I have relatively strong priority (2nd).

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_E is your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the very best in your placement process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E with quota 1, I should aim to match with the highest possible student on my true priority list. My ranking is Student_E > Student_B > Student_A > Student_D > Student_C. In this round I received applications from Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D. Student_D is ranked below both Student_B and Student_A, and Student_B has also stated School_E is their first choice, making them a strong, higher-priority candidate likely to accept. Therefore, I should reject Student_D to preserve my seat for a higher-ranked applicant.

conversation.message: School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your community and contribute actively in academics and school activities. If admitted, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. I have strong priority there (ranked 2nd), so an early application maximizes my chance before other applicants fill the single seat. I’ll apply immediately and clearly express fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your commitment to School_E. We are pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm that you will enroll at School_E as stated in your application.

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLYs from Students D, B, and A. Our true priority is E > B > A > D > C. Student_E has not contacted us and, per their preferences, ranks School_E last, so unlikely to apply. Between current applicants, Student_B is our highest-priority option. Accepting B now secures a very good match and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat if higher-priority E never applies. We already rejected D previously; A is lower priority than B. Therefore accept Student_B.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_E is my top choice. I’m very excited about the opportunity to join and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

We truly appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the best in the remainder of the placement process.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: Our remaining quota is 0 and we are already matched with Student_B via an [ACCEPT] this round. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any incoming [APPLY]. Although Student_A is relatively high on our true priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B), we cannot extend an offer unless capacity opens, so we must reject now.

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions team, I’m Student_E and I’m applying because School_A is one of my top choices. I’m very motivated to join and would commit fully to contributing to the school community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application. [APPLY]
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). Those three students all rank School_C relatively high (B has it 2nd, C has it 2nd, A has it 5th but may still apply later), so applying there first is likely to be rejected. Meanwhile, School_E ranks me 1st, guaranteeing acceptance if I apply. However, School_E is my last choice, so I should not lock it in immediately. I will apply to School_A (my 2nd choice). School_A ranks me last, but many top-priority students for School_A (B and D) strongly prefer School_E first, and A prefers E/B/D above A, so there is a plausible path where School_A becomes available and may accept me if higher-priority applicants don’t apply. Applying now gives me a chance at a high-ranked option without immediately settling for my last choice.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing applications for this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your effort and wish you the best in the remainder of the process. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_E is last on School_A's true priority list (B, D, A, C, E). With quota 1 and only round 1, it is highly likely that higher-priority students (especially Student_D who ranks School_A 2nd, and Student_B who ranks School_A 5th but may come later) could apply in subsequent rounds. Accepting Student_E now would block the seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority student. Since we prefer leaving unfilled over taking someone outside the list (and E is on the list but lowest), optimal strategy is to reject now and keep capacity for higher-ranked candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_D admissions committee, I’m Student_C and School_D is my first-choice school. conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_D as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Waiting risks losing Student_C to another school (they rank School_D first, so they are unlikely to leave unless rejected), while Student_A has School_D as 3rd choice and may never apply if accepted elsewhere. Given quota=1 and the objective to secure as high as possible on our list under uncertainty, accepting Student_C now is prudent and yields a very high-priority match.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_C. Since the process allows up to 30 rounds and my quota is still open, it is optimal to reject Student_E again and wait for higher-priority candidates.
